prompt: <description>**Instructions for part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. 2. Begin drawing a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a new face (face\\_1) and draw the following lines on it to form a rectangle: - line\\_1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start point at [0.75, 0.0], end point at [0.75, 0.25] - line\\_3: Start point at [0.75, 0.25], end point at [0.0, 0.25] - line\\_4: Start point at [0.0, 0.25], end point at [0.0, 0.0] 4. Close the loop and complete the 2D sketch. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.125 units and in the opposite direction by 0.125 units. **Instructions for part 2** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0625, 0.1875, 0.25]. 2. Begin drawing a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a new face (face\\_1) and draw a circle on it with center at [0.0625, 0.0625] and radius of 0.0625. 4. Close the loop and complete the 2D sketch. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.05 units in the opposite direction. Note: The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, where the height is twice the width, and the length is three times the width.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.25,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.25]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.125,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.125,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0625,0.1875,0.25]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.0625,0.0625],"Radius":0.0625}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.05,"sketch_scale":0.125,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Use the following properties for the coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch for part 1, which will be a rectangle. This sketch will be drawn on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The rectangle will be divided into four lines. Here are the details: 1. line_1: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] - End Point: [0.75, 0.0] 2. line_2: - Start Point: [0.75, 0.0] - End Point: [0.75, 0.75] 3. line_3: - Start Point: [0.75, 0.75] - End Point: [0.0, 0.75] 4. line_4: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.75] - End Point: [0.0, 0.0] After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the sketch_scale scaling parameter with a value of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Now, create an extrusion for the 3D model: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.375 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - sketch_scale: 0.75 This extrusion will create a slightly tapered top and bottom on the rectangular prism. The operation for this extrusion is to create a new solid body. The length of part 1 will be 0.75, the width will be 0.75, and the height, which includes the tapered top and bottom, will be 0.375 (0.375 towards the normal and 0 for opposite the normal). The part is characterized by a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Final Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom The final shape takes the form of the part 1 we have constructed. It has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.375 This final shape does not involve any additional steps or assumptions and consists only of the instructions above.</description>
completion:

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.375,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>
